meanings.definition: To shine brighter or more brilliantly than something else.
meanings.sent1: The sun outsparkles the stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: Her smile always outsparkles everyone else's in the room.
meanings.sent3: The little firefly thought it could outsparkle the big lighthouse.
meanings.sent4: The diamond outsparkles all the other gems in the jewelry store.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display outsparkles any other show in town.

meanings.definition: To surpass in sparkle or brightness.
meanings.sent1: The glitter outsparkles the dull paint on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks outsparkles the city lights on New Year's Eve.
meanings.sent3: The disco ball tried to outsparkle the disco dancers on the dance floor.
meanings.sent4: The sequined dress outsparkles all the other outfits at the party.
meanings.sent5: The twinkling stars outsparkle the dim moon in the night sky.
